meanings.definition: to make a mistake or error in judgment
meanings.sent1: She missteers often when trying to follow directions.
meanings.sent2: He missteers occasionally, but he learns from his mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The robot missteers and bumps into walls, thinking they are doors.
meanings.sent4: Her missteering led her down the wrong path, but she eventually found her way.
meanings.sent5: The student missteers frequently in math class, but she never gives up trying.

meanings.definition: plural form of missteer, referring to multiple mistakes or errors
meanings.sent1: The report was full of missteers that needed to be corrected.
meanings.sent2: They discussed the missteers made during the project meeting.
meanings.sent3: The comedy of errors was filled with missteers that made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The book highlighted the missteers of the main character, showing his growth.
meanings.sent5: The team's missteers were evident in the final product, but they still succeeded.

meanings.definition: describing something that is characterized by mistakes or errors
meanings.sent1: The missteers project needed extra time to fix all the errors.
meanings.sent2: The missteers report was full of red marks from the teacher.
meanings.sent3: His missteers behavior always led to funny situations.
meanings.sent4: The missteers path was full of obstacles and challenges.
meanings.sent5: The missteers plan fell apart due to lack of attention to detail.
